mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, George Washington to Lund Washington, 1779 April 3
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Washington, George, 1732-1799
mdRecord.dcterms:description: George Washington writes to Lund Washington from his headquarters in Middlebrook, NJ on 1779 April 3; makes arrangements for a shipment of fine Bordeaux claret; discusses financial matters concerning the estate of George Mercer; references the exchange of two slaves between Mount Vernon and his mother's home in Fredericksburg; questions Lund on the status of planting and propagating of trees, admonishing him for not answering some of his early queries and questions his management techniques; reports that things are slow on the war front and a recent storm impacted British transports. Autograph document signed, 4 pages.
